data.meta_description:
426 likes, 13 comments - vintage_stardust on January 14, 2024: "Remembering actor Humphrey Bogart (1899-1957), who passed away 67 years ago today ğŸ˜. He is seen here with wife Lauren Bacall (1924-2014) in â€œThe Big Sleepâ€ (1946). 

A native New Yorker, Bogart became a stage actor after completing his service in the Navy during WWI. After the 1929 stock market crash saw a sharp decline in stage productions, he headed to Hollywood. Although his career started slowly, Bogart would later become a cinematic icon in classics like â€œThe Maltese Falconâ€ (1941), â€œCasablancaâ€ (1942), and â€œKey Largoâ€ (1948). Receiving Academy Award nominations for â€œCasablancaâ€ and â€œThe Caine Mutinyâ€ (1954), Bogart took home the Oscar for â€œThe African Queenâ€ (1951).

Married four times in total, his final marriage was to Bacall. The celebrated couple had two children, but sadly the 57 year old Bogart died from esophageal cancer when they were just 8 and 5 years old ğŸ˜ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸ’–.
